title: Glacier Bay National Park & Preserve: Fees & Passes
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Fees & Passes              Fees & Passes              Entrance Fees Unlike most national parks, there is NO entrance fee to enter Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve. If you plan on enjoying the park through any commercial outfitters, guides, tour-boats, lodges, etc., you should arrange any reservations through them. Camping Fees NO camping fees are required at Glacier Bay National Park.   Campers in the Bartlett Cove Primitive Campground are required to attend a camper orientation at the Visitor Information Station. A free backcountry permit is required for overnight campers/kayakers.   Boating Permits   If you plan on enjoying Glacier Bay with your private vessel, a free permit is required.    Commercial and Special-use Fees  Filming/photography for commercial purposes may require a special use permit and payment of location fees.           America The Beautiful: The National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Pass Series For more information about passes available for National Parks and Federal Agencies, please visit: www.nps.gov/findapark/passes.htm  NO pass is needed at Glacier Bay.
